comment: Need to try it when I’m sober lol decent
Fruit (apple?) and cinnamon sweet nose. Cinnamon sugar flavor. Warm and smooth cinnamon finish.

Color: 
Medium amber with a touch of brilliant shine. Fairly quick to fall, but long lingering legs. 

Nose:
Strong vanilla up front with a subtle undertone…maybe butterscotch? Nearer notes of light oak and spices 

Palate:
The barley and corn dance around with some baking spices and apple with just a hint of vanilla. It all wraps up with a touch of smoky charred oak

Adding a touch of water blends the grains into something reminiscent of a single malt, highlighting the smooth vanillin rich oakiness
Nose of wet dog and urine. Which I think is just me. Others loved the smell. But strangely I still enjoyed it.
Very hot. Smell is overpowering. Best with a splash of water. Priced too high.

Regardless of the score and lack of refinement - once this bottle is opened, it quickly disappears.  I attribute it to its easy on the pallette drinkability and smooth fruit finish.  At any party with bourbon drinkers, they quickly turn from the makers mark and woodford reserve to downing a few pours of this little goodie. Do not undersatnd distiller tasting note - of cinnamon red hot...if there is a Colorado whiskey to avoid it's Stranahans.
Very solid for a young bourbon.

I found this to be smooth, not hot at all. Given the small size of this craft distiller and single barrel nature of each bottle, perhaps some variation is to be expected. In any case, I loved it. By the way, they make a great pear brandy, too.
Not smooth, too much rye for me.
Definitely taste that red hot Phil is talking about. Oddly I didn't pick that up before.
Good early morning drink, pairs well with sweet Sunday brunch foods. Wet grasses, wildflower honey, cracked black pepper.
Smells honey and brown sugar, smooth light spice, linger flavor of spice.

It needs a little help to open the aroma of baking spice and vanilla. Great mouthfeel. A little apple. Very short finish, vanilla does hang around for a bit. Really pleasant and easy drink if you like sweeter.
not bad, I like 291 better as a local whiskey
My notes have an angry face next to "gross 2x4s." No thank you.
Strong spice with a sweet finish, it’s nice chilled with a drop of water to open it up
The 5 yr version. smooth, with decent vanilla and caramel hightlights, but a definite sharp alcohol taste.
Weak & too sweet.  Didn’t enjoy at all.  Would not do again.
Hot for 88 proof and extremely fruity, spicy. Picked up a lot of oak for being 2 years but not in that smooth Vanilla way
